                        <div class="col-md-10 col-sm-12 px-lg-0 col-lg-8 animatedParent animateOnce mx-auto animatedParent animateOnce" data-sequence="1000" data-aos-duration="230.76923076923077">
                            <h2 class="row col-md-10 mx-auto h-1 font-30 font-weight-light font-family-open animated fadeIn no-padding" data-id="1">
                                Beyond roads and bridges
                            </h2>
                            <p class="col-md-10 col-lg-12 mx-auto key-finding-para font-family-open animated fadeIn no-padding" data-id="1">
                                The shift to remote work and telemedicine has big implications for infrastructure. Purely “physical” infrastructure (roads,
                                bridges, electricity) is shifting to more “physical-digital” infrastructure, with broadband, self-driving cars, and “smart
                                infrastructure” taking center stage. New focus on the environment and broad social benefits are also reshaping
                                infrastructure thinking.
                            </p>
                        </div>

                                    <p class="para font-family-open">

                                        believe that there will be fewer people living in cities.
                                    </p>

    function getCookie(name) 
    {
        var dc = document.cookie;
        var prefix = name + "=";
        var begin = dc.indexOf("; " + prefix);
        if (begin == -1) {
            begin = dc.indexOf(prefix);
            if (begin != 0) return null;
        }
        else
        {
            begin += 2;
            var end = document.cookie.indexOf(";", begin);
            if (end == -1) {
                end = dc.length;
            }
        }
        return unescape(dc.substring(begin + prefix.length, end));
    }
